fields.description:
When migrating database via the FECRU UI, there is no warning or check in place to ensure the destination database is empty or populated. The migration script runs without any warning to the user which may result in data being lost in an existing database, if overwritten from another target database.
There should be a feature in place to help inform the user about data being present and only after receiving a confirmation from the user may the migration proceed.
fields.summary: Warning during database migration

fields.description:
The current FECRU LDAP integration guide: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/LDAP+authentication does not include any note about the [Force lowercase usernames|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Forcing+imported+usernames+to+be+lowercase] feature in Fisheye.
I think this should be mentioned on our LDAP guide for users to know and configure as per their business needs. It appears that many users can easily miss this configuration and end up with duplicate users (different case) in their database.
fields.summary: Include a note about username case in LDAP guide

fields.description:
FishEye, when indexing git repositories, detects default branch on the remote repository.   But this information is not persisted, so after instance restart, the default branch would be unknown until first slurp of remote repository detects new changes that needs to be indexed.  
So for repositories where there is no activity in remote repository since last indexing, or where remote repositories are no longer available, the default branch name would be unknown.
Also, when remote repository has no default branch specified (git remote show <<URL>> returns "HEAD branch: (unknown)" for instance), the default branch would never be set) - perhaps fallback to master would be better?

This causes few problems with FishEye/Crucible:
 * URLs to default branch (HEAD) would fail with "No revision found HEAD" error, because FishEye will be looking up null revision.  See https://fisheye4.atlassian.com/browse/~raw,r=HEAD/activeobjects-git/pom.xml for instance
 * branch reviews would not be able to suggest base branch correctly on branch review creation
 * perhaps others, to be assessed

Suggested fix:
 * persist default branch name locally (e.g. in var/cache/<REPO>/clone/fe_clone.properties file or in local clone (see https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHKB/Setting+a+valid+HEAD+on+your+Git+repository)) between restarts
 * ensure default branch is refreshed on every slurp, even when no change on remote repository is detected
fields.summary: git main branch name unknown until first change detected in remote repository

Caused by: java.io.IOException: error: Error in job specification.error: Error detected at line 11.error: Syntax error in 'SecondLine'. at com.perforce.api.P4Process.closeProcess(P4Process.java:587) at com.perforce.api.Job.commit(Job.java:361) ... 226 more {code} h4. +Note+ * If only 1 line is entered into the text field, a Perforce job is created successfully * In Perforce, multiple lines can be manually entered into the same field * It doesn't matter whether the multi-line text field in JIRA uses Default Text or Wiki Style renderer h4. +Workaround+ Using HTML tag {{
}} to indicate new lines works. For example, using this single line in the multi-line text field: {code}FirstLine
SecondLine
ThirdLine{code} * It appears as a single line, thus it works * In Perforce, the field is rendered correctly with separate lines

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Verify that "Maximum Indexable File Size" is set to 0.1 MB
2. Commit a file larger than 0.1 MB to an SVN repository
3. Verify that FishEye displays "file too large" message when trying to view source
4. Adjust "Maximum Indexable File Size" to 100.0 MB and Save Changes
!svn_index_bug-1.jpg|thumbnail!
5. Re-index the SVN repository.
6. Restart FishEye instance (optional not in documentation).
7. View file source in FishEye - only "Download File" option is availabe
!svn_index_bug-2.jpg|thumbnail!

Result:  previously unviewable text file is still unviewable
After increase, new text files between 0.1 MB and 100 MB are viewable

Link to existing documentation:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Text+file+size+limiting
fields.summary: Increase in "Maximum Indexable File Size" and reindex of SVN repository does not make large files viewable

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using context path (eg: "/fecru"), the repository watch notification email "create a review" link use both value in "Site URL" (eg: http://localhost:8060/fecru) and context path to be an incorrect URL eg: http://localhost:8060/fecru//fecru/cru/create?csid=###

Other links in watch notification is correct except for this "create a review" link

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set a {{Site URL}} including a context path (e.g. {{http://localhost:8060/fecru}})
# Set a {{Web context}} (e.g. {{/fecru}})
# Enable the Email notification
# Make a change for a repository you are watching

h3. Expected Results
All the links in the received email are correct and point to a valid page for FishEye/Crucible.

h3. Actual Results
The "create a review" link is incorrect and contains a duplicated context path:
{{http://localhost:8060/fecru//fecru/cru/create?csid=<revision_id>}}

h3. Workaround
The link can be changed by hardcoding the correct Site URL (including the context path) in the email template.
# Locate the {{<FishEye home directory>/fisheye/html/changeset-mail.ftl}} file
# Change this line (this is line 25 for version 3.8.1):
{noformat}
[@a href="${siteurl}/${csd.createReviewUrl}"]create a review[/@a]
{noformat}
To the following where {{<hardcoded_value>}} is the url of your instance. Note that there {{/}} should be removed.
{noformat}
[@a href="<hardcoded_value>${csd.createReviewUrl}"]create a review[/@a]
{noformat}
fields.summary: Watch Notification create review link incorrect when using context path

I want to see the raw content in FishEye by accessing http://localhost:8060/browse/~raw,r=HEAD/MyGitRepo/TEST.html, but the problem is that the Content-Type is {{text/plain}}.

cURL also says that the the content type is text/plain:
{noformat}
curl -I http://localhost:8060/browse/~raw,r=HEAD/MyGitRepo/TEST.html
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
X-AUSERNAME: anonymous
Set-Cookie: crucibleprefs1="D%3D1426774272886";Path=/;Expires=Fri, 18-Mar-2016 14:11:12 GMT
Expires: Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT
Last-Modified: Thu, 19 Mar 2015 14:11:09 GMT
Content-Disposition: inline
Content-Type: text/plain;charset=UTF-8
Content-Length: 99
Server: Jetty(8.1.10.v20130312)

I tried seaching for "$extract-function-qname" in FE 3.7, and was instantly shown links to two files containing that string.

However, when I click on each of the files' links, I'm only redirected to a page showing the different revisions those files went through.

I was hoping that when I clicked on that link, I'd be shown the source code where the search string would be highlighted for quick review.

Doing a similar search in Eclipse would yield a listing of files that contain those search results. And underneath each file are links to specific locations showing the lines containing the searcg string. Click on that line would open the file at that line.

Hope this feature makes into FE one day soon.

fields.description:
In Fisheye/Crucible, the quick search displays a drop-down menu of suggestions after the user begins typing in a query. This menu remains visible even when another menu in the Fisheye toolbar is displayed. Worse, it remains on top of any other menu.

Reproduce:

1) Login to fisheye
2) Type 'test' (or any other common search term) to trigger the suggestions menu to display
3) Click the (?) help button next to quick search

Notice that the quick search suggestions menu does not go away and remains on top of the help menu (in many cases, completely obscuring it). Clicking on any other menu button in the toolbar has the same behaviour -- the suggestions menu stays drawn on top.

Clicking outside the toolbar will cause the suggestions menu to disappear.
fields.summary: Quick search suggestion drop-down obscures other menus

fields.description:
Nowadays it is only possible to [transition JIRA issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Using+smart+commits#Usingsmartcommits-TransitionyourJIRAissues], but you cannot *create* JIRA issues.

A suggestion is to add a command like {{#create}} and the next thing in the commit message should be the JIRA project key, and also add a command like {{#type}} where you can specify if it's a bug, or improvement, etc.
Example:
{noformat}
This is the commit message. #create JRA #type bug #comment this is a comment in JIRA side
{noformat}

Of course, the JIRA issue creation screen should be the default one, without any custom fields.
fields.summary: Smart Commits: Allow creating JIRA issues

fields.description:
h4. Summary

When using JIRA for user management, with {{Auto-add}} set to {{Create a FishEye user on successful login}}, FishEye syncs all users automatically, even though they haven't logged in to FishEye yet. This causes issues with license limits.

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a group in JIRA, for example {{fisheye-users}}.
# Add some users to {{fisheye-users}}.
# Set up FishEye to use JIRA for user management. Ensure {{Auto-add}} is set to true.
# Select {{fisheye-users}} when prompted to select groups to sync.
# Note that all users in {{fisheye-users}} are synced and added, even though they have not logged into FishEye yet.

h4. Workarounds

# Only add users that you would like to sync into the selected groups.
# Remove all users from FishEye that have been synced, and disable automatic synchronisation. The users will be re-added when they login.
fields.summary: FishEye Syncs All Users In Selected Groups From JIRA With Auto-Add Enabled

fields.description:
Add/del links disappear when setting custom rules for Subversion repository in repository setup -> SCM details -> SVN Symbolic Rules.
When you click the link to add new field a new empty row is added below current one. Current row 'Add' link disappears (the one that was clicked), the new row has 'Del' and 'Add' links available.
You cannot add new row below old 'current' row. 
If you delete newly created row, the 'Add' link is still unavailable, so you cannot delete and add a new one. 
If you add and then delete all added rows, you end up without possibility to add a new one.
fields.summary: SVN repo custom SVN Symbolic Rules - 'Add' link disappears

fields.description:
For searches using the FreeTextAnalyzer (notably content and diff searcher), if the input contains multiple operator characters (generally special characters like '+', '-', '@', /', etc.) next to each other, either all or none of the operator characters must be specified in the query when searching. 

Example:
# Have a file with the following content:
{noformat}
>@test
{noformat}
# If searching for *>@test*, the file is returned
# If searching for *@test*, the file is not returned
# If searching for *is-test*, the file is returned.
fields.summary: Freetext searches don't allow partial operator matching
Directories beginning with "~" treated as an invalid repository name by Directory Scanning Plugin

fields.description:
Nowadays it's only possible to use the {{displayName}} attribute in FishEye.
However, other Atlassian products such as Bamboo allow using {{givenName}} and {{sn}} attributes instead.

I've just came across this use-case:
* In LDAP, all *hundreds of* users' {{displayName}} attribute is in the {{\{lastName, firstName\}}} format. These users also have {{givenName}} and {{sn}} attributes configured accordingly.
* In FishEye, {{displayName}} is being used in {{Display Name Attribute}} field.
* However, now in FishEye I want to display user names in the {{\{firstName lastName\}}} format.
* Changing all *hundreds of* users's {{displayName}} in LDAP and re-sync the user base in FishEye is definitely not practical, it would require a lot of manual work.
* FishEye should allow using the {{givenName}} and {{sn}} attributes along with {{displayName}} attribute, just like other Atlassian products do.
fields.summary: Allow using GivenName and SN attributes in LDAP config

fields.description:
FishEye and Crucible will always assume there is a a trunk with "trunk" name in any svn repository. This will appear in :
* the default base branch on the branch review screen
* the first branch at the branch selector list on the branch review screen
* the first branch at the branch selector list on the repository browser
fields.summary: FishEye and Crucible always shows "trunk" for svn even if it doesn't exist

fields.description:
When FishEye is connected to Crowd and SSO is on it is possible to authenticate with a user in FishEye if this user is removed from the group being synchronized in Crowd. This is done by basically clicking in the *Unable to access your account?* link, which refreshes the page and shows FishEye as authenticated with this user (maybe this is because of some cache in the browser).

*Background configuration*
Crowd:
* User *admin*, member of the group *fecru-users*.

FishEye:
* Connected to Crowd with SSO, synchronizing the group *fecru-users*.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# In Crowd, remove *fecru-users* from *admin*'s groups list.
# In FishEye, try to login with admin. It will fail (Unknown user or password).
# In FishEye, click in *Unable to access your account?*. You are now logged in as *admin*.

Some points to note:
* At some point I authenticated as this *admin* user in FishEye, but this was before trying to reproduce the issue. I don't know the details of how SSO works, and if there is a cookie that lives there for some time.
* By the moment I was reproducing this I didn't log in with the *admin* user at any time. I was actually logged as my own user in Crowd, and not logged in FishEye.
fields.summary: Crowd with SSO authenticates user without password

fields.description:
SVN indexing does processing inside JavaHL callbacks. It may prolong SVN command execution time significantly even causing it to timeout.

Possible improvements:

fields.summary: Mitigate SVN timeout issues

fields.description:
If a Subversion repository contains a file that has a path containing URL decodable sequences (%XX where X is a 0-9 or A-F) or spaces then *recursive* operations fail when the HTTP or HTTPS protocol is used.

For example if there is a path in the repository such as {{/branches/dir-with-percents-%28brackets%29/file.txt}} then 
{code}
svn info -R http://SERVER/branches
{code} 

fails with an error similar to:

{code:none}
Repository paused due to error com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryClientException: org.apache.subversion.javahl.ClientException: svn: E160013: '/svn/repository/!svn/bc/2/branches/dir-with-percents-(brackets)/file.txt' path not found: 404 Not Found (http://SERVER) org.apache.subversion.javahl.ClientException: svn: E160013: '/svn/repository/!svn/bc/2/branches/dir-with-percents-(brackets)/file.txt' path not found: 404 Not Found (http://SERVER) org.tmatesoft.svn.core.SVNException: svn: E160013: '/svn/repository/!svn/bc/2/branches/dir-with-percents-(brackets)/file.txt' path not found: 404 Not Found (http://SERVER)
{code}

The problem is caused by the improper escaping of URIs in {{mod_dav}}. This issue has been reintroduced is some Apache Httpd releases, however it seems to be finally fixed in *Httpd 2.4.10*. More information is available here:
* https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/apache2/+bug/1284641
* https://bz.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=56480
* https://bz.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=55397
* https://bz.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=54611

For example calling
{noformat}
svn info -R http://SERVER/branches
{noformat}

Makes a {{PROPFIND}} HTTP request to the SVN repository, similar to the following:

{noformat}
curl -H "Depth: 1" -X PROPFIND http://SERVER/repo/\!svn/rvr/5/branches
{noformat}

Where the proper response looks like (Apache Httpd 2.2.31):

{code:xml}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<D:multistatus xmlns:D="DAV:">
  <D:response xmlns:S="http://subversion.tigris.org/xmlns/svn/" ...>
    <D:href>/repo/!svn/rvr/5/branches/</D:href>
    ...
  </D:response>
  <D:response xmlns:S="http://subversion.tigris.org/xmlns/svn/"...>
    <D:href>/repo/!svn/rvr/5/branches/dir-with-percents-%2528brackets%2529/</D:href> <!-- NOTE THE DIFFERENCE HERE. % is escaped resulting in %25 string -->
   ...
{code}

A vulnerable version of Httpd won't escape the {{%}} character causing the output to look like (Apache Httpd 2.2.26):

{code:xml}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<D:multistatus xmlns:D="DAV:">
  <D:response xmlns:S="http://subversion.tigris.org/xmlns/svn/" ...>
    <D:href>/repo/!svn/rvr/5/branches/</D:href>
    ...
  </D:response>
  <D:response xmlns:S="http://subversion.tigris.org/xmlns/svn/" ...>
    <D:href>/repo/!svn/rvr/5/branches/dir-with-percents-%28brackets%29/</D:href>  <!-- NOTE THE DIFFERENCE HERE. % is not escaped -->
   ...
{code}

h3. Workaround

# Upgrade Apache Httpd to version *2.4.10+*
# Configure Fisheye repository to use [file://] (possibly with [svnsync|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Improve+FishEye+scan+performance]) or svn://.
## Protocol svn+ssh:// cannot be used due to an existing bug in SVNKit: https://issues.tmatesoft.com/issue/SVNKIT-476
fields.summary: SVN E160013 404 Not Found for paths with url decodable seqences

The suggestion is to have the Windows intaller warning the user if the JVM isn't detected when installing or upgrading FishEye. If the JVM is not detected this can cause a few issues as it will use the JVM that comes bundled with the installer.

If the user had certificates in his JVM, for instance, FishEye will fail connecting to applications using SSL that were previously working.

For the resolution, to make FishEye use the proper JVM, please refer to [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHKB/PKIX+path+building+failed+after+upgrading+FishEye+Crucible]
fields.summary: Windows installer: warn user if JVM is not detected

- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Supported+platforms
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Supported+platforms
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Migrating+to+MySQL
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Migrating+to+MySQL

MariaDB and Percona are proven to cause problems with FishEye/Crucible and we have open feature requests to support those (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FE-5159, https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FE-5284, https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FE-5282), but since the documentation do not specifically mention they are not supported, in many cases users will make the assumption they are okay to use.

fields.description:
In some cases requests to get blame will call out to the SCM to retrieve it. This happen if storing blame is disabled globally (via the fisheye.blame.calc.enable [system property|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE035/System+Properties]), or for SVN if the changeset is not completely indexed yet.

The fetched blame is used by that request, but not persisted anywhere, so subsequent calls will reach out to the SCM again, until the blame is available from indexing (or always in case storing blame is completely disabled). 

The retrieved blame should be persisted instead, so that subsequent calls don't need to re-fetch it.
fields.summary: Blame SCM fallback should persist the fetched blame

fields.description:
Nowadays, empty directories and deleted files can be hidden while browsing the repository.

However, some repository types such as SVN allow deleting branches (by running, for example, {{svn rm branches/xx && svn commit -m 'branch removal'}}).

These deleted branches cannot be hidden in FishEye.
It would be great to be able to hide them while browsing the repository and also from the branch selector.

*Possible workarounds:*
* Configuring a [Start Revision|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Subversion]
* [Adding excludes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Include+Exclude+paths#IncludeExcludepaths-AddinganExclude]

In both cases, it is required to re-index the repository from scratch.
fields.summary: Add an option to show/hide deleted branches

fields.description:
In the {{FishEye's Administration > System Info}} page there is a line showing the *Total Memory*, which is the memory currently allocated by FishEye. Sometimes this causes confusion, because the Total Memory isn't actually what is defined as maximum heap (Xmx) but what is currently allocated, i.e. it may grow under demand (respecting the limit defined by the Xmx value).

This is the meaning for these values:
- *Total memory* shows the current size of the heap that the JVM used by FishEye is allocating. It does not reflect -Xmx. This heap can grow and shrink as needed, and varies according to what is defined as minimum (-Xms) and maximum (-Xmx) allowed heap.
- *Free memory* shows what is free from the current heap (total memory)

Maybe this information could go in [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/How+FishEye+uses+memory].
fields.summary: Explain "Total Memory" and "Free memory" in the documentation

h3. Notes

This is due to FishEye's SAL implementation returning a fake user for the admin password session, that isn't an actual user in the system.

h3. Workaround

Workaround is to log in as an actual user to confirm OAuth tokens, and not use the admin password account for that.
fields.summary: Trying to approve OAuth token when logged in via the admin password causes an error

fields.description:
Nowadays a sample response of [/rest-service-fe/repositories-v1|https://docs.atlassian.com/fisheye-crucible/latest/wadl/fisheye.html#rest-service-fe:repositories-v1] is:
{code:xml}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<repositoryList>
    <repository repositoryState="RUNNING" name="project" finishedFullSlurp="true" enabled="true"/>
    <repository repositoryState="STOPPED" name="project-hg" finishedFullSlurp="true" enabled="false"/>
</repositoryList>
{code}
The repository description should be included in the response.
fields.summary: REST API /rest-service-fe/repositories-v1 should include repositories description

fields.description: By default if no SMTP connection timeout is set, FishEye/Crucible's SMTP connections will have no timeout, potentially starving the mailer thread if the connection stalls.
fields.summary: SMTP connections should have a default timeout to prevent connections from hanging and never recovering

fields.description:
These are cached, but the cache is pretty inefficient and not very large by default (1000 entries).

For instances with a large number of committers this will execute n lookups where n is the total number of commiters for the browsed paths. Each lookup might take up to 3 sql queries for unmapped users.
fields.summary: Browsing directories in FishEye might execute multiple db queries for user mappings

fields.description:
A Git branch containing the character *+* in its name (e.g. *test+sign*) isn't properly indexed by FishEye.

When filtering by *All branches and tags* the new branch shows up in the Activity stream of the repository, but when filtering by this branch it is shown in the filter as containing a white space instead of the + sign, and shows no activity or files:
!branchname.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Git branch containing a + sign in its name is not properly indexed

fields.description:
Camel case search feature allows to search paths by providing only capital letters. It may be costly as it uses term index to find possible matches. I've noticed it especially for strings being Jira issues.

We need flag to disable that feature.
fields.summary: Optimize camel case search for paths

fields.description:
Indexing threads may constantly change Lucene index. Re-opening readers is costly from performance and memory (many copies kept simultaneously) perspective.

We must reduce number of reader re-opens.
fields.summary: Reopen Lucene readers less often

fields.description:
For big instances Lucene indexes having millions documents and more the size of term cache is noticeably big. It was reported that instance with >50 million documents has term cache of size ~2GB.

Lucene memory footprint was improved in https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LUCENE-2205
fields.summary: Reduce term cache size for Lucene indexes

fields.summary: Activity stream and changeset log allocate huge amounts of memory

fields.description:
Password reset remainder email uses old FishEye logo.  Let's review other potential places where it is used, same applies to old Crucible logo most likely.
Old logo attached, notice different font and letter case.
fields.summary: Old FishEye logo

fields.description:
Starting from 3.1 Fisheye uses single Lucene index for all repositories known as cross-repository index. It was observed for 3.5.5 that Lucene causes OOME for large instance. Cross-repository index terms retained about 2GB of RAM and field caches kept 1GB for longs nd 0.5GB for ints.

Potential solutions:
* term index
** bump Lucene deom 3.0 to 3.6 or 4.x to get benefits from https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LUCENE-2205 or described on http://blog.mikemccandless.com/2010/07/lucenes-ram-usage-for-searching.html. Potentially it might save 1GB.
* field cache (for fields used in sort)
** shave long to int for dTimeMillis and lastModified - reduces used size by 2 to save 0.5GB
** dTimiesMillis and lastModified should be merged into one field - it would decrease number of field caches by 1. Potential quick win
** reduce all used by RecencyBoostingQuery or sorting timestamp fields lastUpdateHours (changeset), lastModifiedHrs (path), lastModified (branch), dTimeMillis (changeset) to one field dTimeSecs and reduce its size to integer. It would give us reduction of memory used by FieldCache(s) to 1/6 (1.5GB -> 250MB)
** do not sort if possible
fields.summary: Big memory consumption on big instances caused by Lucene

fields.description:
Hi Gents

I have a set of repos, sync'd with some Perforce depots.

Until now, they are sync'd with production servers. I'd like now to have them sync'd on proxies instead, connected on those production servers. So the current info stored in FishEye should not be impacted.

When changing the concerned host (SCM Details -> Perforce Connexion Details -> Host), from the production server to a proxy, the connexion is OK, and in the end, I get a message:

'A configuration change was made which requires a restart of the repository'.

I can understand that :) But since those repos are huge, and have a big set of data, as since the data haven't changed, I wouldn't like a restart to sync again the whole data. 

Question1: will a restart sync from changelist 0 up to the current changelist?
Question2: if I don't want a full sync from 0, should I answer 'Ignore' to the invitation for restarting, and sync manually from a changelist to the last one?

Thanks for your help

Regis
fields.summary: FishEye: Modification of a Repository setting

fields.description:
Trying to create an application link in Fisheye ($fisheye_url/plugins/servlet/applinks/listApplicationLinks) will display this error message:

{quote}(!) No response was received from the URL you entered - it may not be valid. Please fix the URL below, if needed, and click Continue.{quote}

when the causal error is a failed SSL handshake with the entered URL.

To fix this issue
# a proper error message, informing the administrator of the failed handshake, should be displayed;
# the "Configure Application URL" dialog should not be displayed (because the URL was not wrong in the first place and
# (optional) display a help text telling the admin to add the CA/cert to the truststore and link to [the documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/FishEye+SSL+configuration] .
fields.summary: Configure Application Links error message incorrect

fields.description:
If using Trusted Authentication for the Application Link between FishEye and Stash, only public repositories are displayed. 

*Steps to Reproduce*

# Create an Application Link between Stash and FishEye with only Trusted Authentication
# In FishEye, try to add a Stash repository using the {{Stash repositories}} tab
# Only public repositories will be displayed

*Workaround*

Switch to using OAuth authentication for the Application Link
fields.summary: Only public repositories from Stash can be added when using Trusted Authentication
